TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataEncoding extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the encoding of a object.
Docs.remarks: This type specifies the encoding of a object. This encoding is useful to give the backend a hint on the type of data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.DataEncoding Armor = int32(3)

Docs.summary: This specifies that the data is encoded in an armored form as used by OpenPGP and PEM.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.DataEncoding Base64 = int32(2)

Docs.summary: This specifies that the data is encoded using the Base-64 encoding scheme as used by MIME and other protocols.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.DataEncoding Binary = int32(1)

Docs.summary: This specifies that the data is encoding in binary form; i.e. there is no special encoding.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Libgpgme.DataEncoding None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: This specifies that the encoding is not known. This is the default for a new data object. The backend will try its best to detect the encoding automatically.
